subject_terms_3: Photography Istana Government House Colonial architecture
materials_name: albumen (egg white protein) albumen paper paper (fiber product)
physical_appearance: This is a photograph of a colonial-style Government House in Singapore. The photograph features a side-view of the large building. The ground level of the building is made of rounded archways, while the higher level of the building is outlined with tall columns. The foreground of the photograph shows the grounds of the building, with several trees. The title is written at the bottom, below the photograph.
title_text: Photograph album of views and portraits in the Punjab, Cashmere, Ceylon, Burma, Penang, Singapore, and Java Istana, Singapore
subject_terms_1: government office buildings colonization British Colonial
subject_terms_2: Photographs Thomson, J. (John), 1837-1921 Singapore Istana (Singapore) Colonization
